title: crypdick message
description: testing ZeroNet and Namecoin. I hope to turn this into an actual site someday once Zeronet matures.

post.title: Success! New domain name at crypdick.bit!
post.body: Hat tip to the [0List blog](/1Ajp75FXAxdTzRiRTpdBgd4exvbo4gMW12/?Post:2:Free+.bit+Domains+for+ZeroNet+Sites) for the free .bit addresses ^_^

post.title: How to find a ZeroNet page using a keyword search in terminal
post.body:
A few days ago, I found [a blog post](/1Ajp75FXAxdTzRiRTpdBgd4exvbo4gMW12/?Post:2:Free+.bit+Domains+for+ZeroNet+Sites) offering free .bit domains. Today, I tried to find the post again, but I hadn't bookmarked the site. The `Kaffeine.bit` search engine only seems to find the title of a website, but it doesn't index their content.

I found the website by using a `grep` command in terminal:

`grep -rnwi /path/to/ZeroNet/data/directory -e "keywords here"`

That gave me the ZeroNet address (in this case, `1Ajp75FXAxdTzRiRTpdBgd4exvbo4gMW12`) which I used to navigate to the site :)

post.title: blog: check. needed: a .bit address
post.body: Namecoin looks like it's a lot more complicated than it should be.
